item.title: Boitsfort / Bosvoorde Market: place A. Gilson
item.body:
Sunday - 8:00 > 13:00

food, clothes, flowers and plants, craftwork and household goods.
Countryside ambience for a Sunday shopping alongside the ponds with the jeering ducks.

item.title: Flagey
item.body: Everyday except Monday: 8 a.m. - 1 p.m.)
item.address: avenue Général de Gaulle / Gen. De Gaullelaan

item.title: Auderghem
item.body: Thursday: 8.30 a.m. - 12.30 p.m.

item.title: Place Dumon Market (Woluwe-Saint-Pierre)
item.body:
Tuesday, Friday and Saturday - 8:00 > 13:00

food, flowers, local products, a bit of organic food, accessories and trinkets of all sorts.
Village ambience very close to the city.

item.title: Brussels centre - place de l’Agora
item.body:
(nearby Grand-Place)
Friday, Saturday, Sunday and public holidays - 10:00 > 18:00
 

arts & craft market
This market could be called : "another way of buying souvenirs".

item.title: Centre / Centrum
item.body: Wednesday : 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. (organic products)

item.title: Brussels centre - place Sainte-Catherine
item.body:
Thursday, Friday and Saturday - 7:00 > 17:00
Wednesday - organic market - 7:30 > 15:00

food and flowers, seafood to savour on the spot or to take away
One of the oldest markets of Brussels.

item.title: Brussels centre : Grand-Place
item.body:
every day except Monday and Thursday - 8:00 > 18:00

flowers, plants and seedlings.
...offer some flowers on one of the most beautiful squares in the world ...Very romantic!

item.title: Centre / Centrum
item.body: Tuesday from 8 a.m. to 12.30 a.m.

item.title: Etterbeek : market place Jourdan
item.body:
Sunday - 7:00 > 14:00

food, flowers and clothes
A village ambience in the heart of the European Quarter 
Cosmopolitan terraces and the utmost famous "friterie" (chip stand) Antoine.

item.title: Forest / Vorst
item.body: Thursday to Sunday :8 a.m. - 1 .p.m.

item.title: Ixelles : place du Châtelain
item.body:
(1050 Brussels)
Wednesday - 14:00 > 19:00

traditional food, delicatessen, flowers and trendy trinkets.
Select ambience and smart terraces all around.

item.title: Brussels centre : Midi market - place Bara and surroundings of the Midi-station
item.body:
Dimanche - 6:00 > 13:00

marché méditerranéen : fruits et légumes, viandes et poissons, épices et aromates, textiles, accessoires et chaussures.
Il faut bien toute une matinée pour le parcourir en entier : dépaysement et exotique garanti!

item.title: Schaerbeek
item.body: Friday from 2 p.m. to 7 p.m.

item.title: parvis de St-Gilles + rue du Fort on Saturday & Sunday
item.body:
(square in front of the church)
every day except on Monday - 9:00 > 13:00

 
fruit and vegetables, cheese and delicatessen from here and from Italy, spices and sweets, roasted chicken and trinkets of all sorts.
Village ambience with traditional cafés and trendy bistros.

item.title: Brussels centre : Grand Sablon
item.body:
Saturday 9:00 > 17:00 - Sunday 9:00 > 14:00

Antiques market : ancient books, crockery and cutlery, jewels and engravings
A well-known place of the bargain hunters - a must for the lovers of elegant strolling.

item.title: Place Van Meenen market (Saint-Gilles)
item.body:
Monday - 12:00 > 19:00

food, clothes, flowers and sampling stands.
For the gourmets : the specialties of the nearby restaurant "Café des Spores", seafood, Thai food and couscous ... are served till 21:00.

item.title: Anderlecht : market rue Ropsy-Chaudron
item.body:
Friday, Saturday and Sunday - 6:00 >14:00

A huge and global market: meat, fruit, vegetables, flowers and plants, clothes, secondhand and even animals!
On the site of the old slaughterhouse; glittering shops around propose professional kitchen equipment.

item.title: ORGANIC MARKETS ALL YEAR-ROUND
item.body: Keen to know where to find fresh, organic and seasonal produce? Try the market on Place Ste. Catherine or even the one in the Atelier des Tanneurs. Market gardeners and farmers who specialise in producing and selling produce that comes exclusively from organic agriculture and farming gather on the Place Ste. Catherine on Wednesday mornings, and on Wednesdays, Fridays and weekends at the Tanneurs. Both sites are typical of old Brussels. Besides fruit and vegetables direct from the farm, you can also find high-quality cooked pork meats and salt meats, cheeses, meats and poultry. Take a walk round these markets, meet the producers who supply different purchasing group points in Brussels, and find out more about joining ’organic basket’ schemes.

item.title: Jette : "le rayon vert" organic market
item.address: Rue Gustave Van Huynegem, 32/Gustave Van Huynegemstraat, 32

item.title: Marché gourmet du sablon
item.body:
At the initiative of the non-profit making organization « Commune Libre du Sablon », under the patronage of the city of Brussels, and the municipal councillor of Trade Marion Lemesre, a new market will from now on take place in front of the Church of the Sablon and will be organized every Thursday from 3 pm until 9 pm.
 
The market was launched on November 7th 2013 and aims to promote values such as short-circuit distribution, make consumers sensitive to high-quality and healthy food and defend home-made transformation and production methods.
 
The goal is to propose and sell high-quality products but also to create a friendly atmosphere where people can meet and exchange in the heart of the city : answer the needs of the residents, encourage commuters to stay in the city after work and add yet another tourist spot in this hotspot.
 
More or less 20 stallholders will propose a variety of different products amongst which : vegetables, fruit, dairy products, wine, champaign, truffles, cooked meats, honey, dried fruit, fish, biscuits…
 
There will be a separate savouring spot in the centre of the market where you will have a good overview of the different products on the market, as well as a beautiful view on the Sablon. The tents of the stallholders will all look similar in order to give balance to the market and make it a nice, enjoyable space.
 
Don’t hesitate to come and have a drink, taste delicious products or purchase high-quality food before going home to cook.
item.address: Parvis de l’Eglise du Sablon/Voorplein van de kerk van de Zavel

item.title: Brussels Vintage Market
item.body: Every first Sunday of the month, the Brussels Vintage Market unpacks in Halles Saint-Géry (Sint-Gorikshallen). Vintage clothes and furniture sellers as well as young designers all gather to provide visitors with an original and varied shopping experience. Obviously, it would not be good fun without a fair amount of food and drinks.
